text: you probably have a waffle iron
somewhere there in the back of your
cabinets do you pull it out what once or
twice a year to make that special
occasion breakfast well I want you to
use your waffle iron even more because
you know why waffles are delicious
here's the important thing about using
your waffle iron you need to get to know
it because every model is a little bit
different for mine I need to preheat it
all the way I like to do it on a low
setting and I let the waffles cook for a
little bit longer I think they get
really crisp that way my favorite
waffles to make our cornmeal waffles the
cornmeal is great because it adds a
little bit of extra texture a little bit
of extra crunch and also a sweet flavor
so in this bowl here I've got my dry
ingredients a little bit of sugar flour
baking soda baking powder and salt and
then I'm just gonna add fine cornmeal
and just mix it in that's important for
no matter what your baking you always
want to get your dry ingredients well
mixed before you add your wet
ingredients to the bowl I've got egg
yolks sour cream or you could use yogurt
if you like and then milk and melted
butter very important lots of butter and
the wet ingredients go into the dry
ingredients there are a lot of different
kinds of waffle batter is you can make
your waffle batter with yeast and it
rises really nicely I'm gonna do an egg
white lightened waffle batter and the
egg whites just make it really fluffy
but you have to beat them
you want your egg whites to be fluffy
and to hold a little pink but they
shouldn't be dry that's what you want
and now I'm just gonna fold them into
the batter I'm gonna start off folding
half in and then I'm gonna have the rest
fold until the whites disappear take
your time when you do this so the egg
whites here are important because they
make the waffles really fluffy and if
you didn't have them the waffles would
still be good if you just use whole eggs
right in the batter but they're better
with the fluffy egg whites I've got my
waffle batter I've got my nice preheated
waffle iron set this one at five and now
I'm just gonna grease it up oh if you
happen to have a nonstick waffle iron
you're probably wondering if you have to
butter it each time in between each
waffle and the answer is no you don't
have to but I say you probably should
because if you do it you're gonna be
missing out on that extra buttery flavor
so I would do it anyway so here's a
waffle trick for you when I first put
the waffle batter and there was a ton of
steam coming out and as the steam starts
to diminish and now there's just a
little bit of steam that's a good time
to check your waffle because it's
probably almost ready or maybe it is
ready like this guy is ready now I'm
gonna serve my cornmeal waffle with a
special little syrup that I simmered
together
imagine Bananas Foster except as a syrup
for waffles it has caramelized bananas a
little bit of bourbon maple syrup and
toasted pecans and I'm going to slather
it all over the top so this is a
slightly more sophisticated waffle than
usual and totally worth taking your
waffle iron down for
you
